oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pasteurella haemolytica Vaccines and Their Effectiveness
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Loan, Raymond W.
Purdy, Charles W. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasteurella haemolytica
immune response
Bacterin-toxoid vaccine
inoculation
formulations
intramuscular
subcutaneous
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pasteurella haemolytica biotype A, serotype 1 (Ph1) bacterins and bacterin-toxoids formulated in oil adjuvants induce protective immune responses approaching those induced by virulent Ph1. In comparison, aluminum hydroxide based adjuvants induce lower protective and serological immune responses. Bacterin-toxoid vaccines formulated in water-in-oil adjuvants induced high levels of protective immunity against transthoracic and field challenge. Bacterin-toxoid with oil-in-water adjuvant induced high protective immunity against transthoracic challenge and was superior to Ph1 bacterin-toxoid withAI(OH)3 adjuvant. Reactions at the point of inoculation vary with formulations, are usually inapparent if intramuscular, manageable if subcutaneous and disappear with time.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1995; 229-231
